isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD (Reconditioning)

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: With cylinder head removed, disassemble as follows:

step1.para: Remove injection nozzles by turning (CCW) counterclockwise. Pull nozzle assembly with copper gasket from the head.

caution.para: be extremely careful not to damage nozzle tips during removal.

step1.para:
Place nozzle assemblies in holding rack ZTSE4141 to prevent damage to tips as they are removed from the heads, Figure 3.23
. Use of this fixture permits replacing nozzles in their respective ports in the cylinder heads. Assure tips and tubing connections are capped with ZTSE4135 protector caps.
Remove glow plugs using appropriate deep socket.

important.para: TO PROTECT THE VALVE SEATS, REMOVE DEPOSITS AND GASKET MATERIAL FROM THE COMBUSTION CHAMBERS, VALVE HEADS AND GASKET SURFACE WITH A SCRAPER AND WIRE BRUSH BEFORE REMOVING THE VALVES FROM THE HEAD.

step1.para: MINERAL SPIRITS TESTPrior to valve removal, squirt mineral spirits into each intake and exhaust port (one at a time). Inspect the valve seat areas for leakage. If leakage is present that valve seat must be repaired.

VALVE HEAD RECESSION (Relative to Deck)Prior to valve removal, measure valve recession ( Figure 3.59
). If out of specifications, valve and valve seat require reconditioning or replacement.
Remove valves from cylinder head as follows:

step2.para:
Using valve spring compressor tool ZTSE1846 (Figure 3.24
) compress the valve springs.
Remove the retainer locks, retainer (with oil shield), spring w/damper, valve stem seal (intake only) and valve rotator.

important.para: ENGINES BUILT AFTER S/N 520428 DO NOT USE THE SMALL NYLON INTAKE OIL SHIELD. SERVICE OF ENGINES BUILT WITH THE SMALL NYLON INTAKE OIL SHIELD REQUIRES THAT IT BE DELETED DURING ASSEMBLY.
DO NOT CONFUSE THE NYLON INTAKE VALVE STEM OIL SHIELD (LOCATED UNDER THE RETAINER) WITH THE RUBBER VALVE STEM SEAL (LOCATED AT THE VALVE GUIDE). THE RUBBER SEAL MUST REMAIN IN PLACE.
KEEP VALVES AND THEIR RELATED PARTS TOGETHER SO THEY MAY BE REINSTALLED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE POSITIONS.

step1.para:
If pre-combustion chamber inserts are to be reused, remove as follows: Using a brass rod inserted in the nozzle bore, the pre-combustion chamber insert can be driven out of the cylinder head with a hammer. Refer to Figure 3.25
.

important.para: GLOW PLUGS MUST BE REMOVED WHEN USING THIS METHOD.

step1.para:
The pre-combustion chamber can also be removed with a "J" hook and slide hammer, Figure 3.26
.

note.para: The slide hammer method can crack the pre-combustion chamber insert.
